author: Drew Hinshaw
title: On Abortion Rights, Ireland Has Mirror Image in Conservative Poland
text:
WARSAW, Poland—Ireland’s vote on Friday to legalize abortion echoed through another Roman Catholic-majority country in Europe, but one where the procedure is broadly illegal and the subject of a continuing battle.
“Ireland could be a pattern for Poland,” said Rozalia Kielmans-Ratynska, a legal analyst at the antiabortion Ordo Iuris Institute. “We think that now there will be pressure on Poland also to go the same direction.”
The... RELATED VIDEO Ireland's Battle Over Abortion The people of Ireland on May 25 will vote in a referendum on whether to repeal its ban on abortion, one of the most bitterly contested battlegrounds in the country. For both sides, it's more than a debate about abortion rights—it's a battle over health care, human rights, identity and values. WSJ's Niki Blasina reports.
